meanings.definition: The state or quality of being dominant.
meanings.sent1: Her dominancy in the group was evident as she always led the activities.
meanings.sent2: The lion's dominancy in the jungle ensured it got the best hunting grounds.
meanings.sent3: The dominancy of the queen bee in the hive made all the other bees follow her lead.
meanings.sent4: His dominancy over the chessboard was unmatched, winning every game effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The dominancy of the sun in the sky made everything bright and warm.

meanings.definition: The power or right to control or influence others.
meanings.sent1: The dictator's dominancy over the country oppressed its citizens.
meanings.sent2: In a democracy, the people hold the dominancy through their votes.
meanings.sent3: The dominancy of the magician over the audience left them in awe of his tricks.
meanings.sent4: Her dominancy over the negotiations ensured a favorable outcome for her team.
meanings.sent5: The dominancy of the storm over the sea was a sight to behold, with waves crashing violently.

meanings.definition: The state of being in a position of authority or control.
meanings.sent1: His dominancy as the CEO of the company allowed him to make important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's dominancy in the classroom maintained order and discipline.
meanings.sent3: The dominancy of the referee on the field ensured fair play during the game.
meanings.sent4: The dominancy of the judge in the courtroom brought justice to those who deserved it.
meanings.sent5: The dominancy of the lighthouse on the cliff guided ships safely through the night.
